org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket

Interface WebSocketObserver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExtensionFilter, WebSocketFuzzerHandler, WebSocketPanel, WebSocketProxyListenerBreak, WebSocketStorage

    public interface WebSocketObserver
    Provides a callback mechanism to get notified of WebSocket messages.

    You can add your observer to a specific channel via WebSocketProxy.addObserver(WebSocketObserver). Alternatively you can set up your observer for all channels, that come into existence in the future. Call either ExtensionWebSocket.addAllChannelObserver(WebSocketObserver) direct or use ExtensionHook.addWebSocketObserver(WebSocketObserver).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getObservingOrder()
      The observer with the lowest ordering value will receive the message first.
      boolean onMessageFrame(int channelId, WebSocketMessage message)
      Called by the observed class (WebSocketProxy) when a new part of a message arrives.
      void onStateChange(WebSocketProxy.State state, WebSocketProxy proxy)

    • Method Detail

      • getObservingOrder

        int getObservingOrder()
        The observer with the lowest ordering value will receive the message first.
        Returns:
        observing order

      • onMessageFrame

        boolean onMessageFrame(int channelId,
                     WebSocketMessage message)
        Called by the observed class (WebSocketProxy) when a new part of a message arrives.

        Use WebSocketMessage.isFinished() to determine if it is ready to process. If false is returned, the given message part will not be further processed (i.e. forwarded).

        Parameters:
        channelId -
        message - contains message parts received so far
        Returns:
        True for continuing to notify and forwarding message

      • onStateChange

        void onStateChange(WebSocketProxy.State state,
                 WebSocketProxy proxy)
        Called by the observed class (WebSocketProxy) when its internal WebSocketProxy.state changes.

        This state does not only represent all possible WebSocket connection states, but also state changes that affect how messages are processed.

        Parameters:
        state - new state
        proxy -
